item.title: Lasso Regression
item.description:
Like statistics and algorithms, optimization is one of those areas that I always feel like I could learn some more from.

I want to talk a little about the optimization of the lasso objective. It is a good introduction to techniques used in convex analysis, that are not taught in most undergrade optimization courses. Its good to be exposed to this, since many real world optimization problems are not solvable using the classic ‘take the derivative and solve for when it is zero’ trick

[ f(x^{}) = f(x) + \nable f(x)^T (x^{} - x) + \frac{1}{2}(x^{} - x)^T H(x) (x^ - x) ]

item.title: Image Vis
item.description: I rescently presented a talk on building a classifier for image and text data. One thing I noticed was the lack of libraries for make plots for exploratory data analysis of image data. EDA is an extremely important aspect of data analysis, and that should be no different if you’re looking at images, text, or normal tabular data.

item.title: Hello world!
item.description:
This is the launch of the blog on my personal site. I am still not sure what this blog will contain. In fact, I am starting this blog to develop my writing voice and style. However, I know that it will primarily be a place I can expand on ideas relevant to my research and work interests. So expect to read a lot of musings on statistical concepts, data science topics, coding tricks, software libraries, and current trends in machine learning.

When I started learning statistics and data science, I found reading people’s blogs crucial to my learning experience. They offered an applied and down-to-earth look at concepts that seemed very disconnected and boring when presented in a textbook. Often times I could take the information in a blog post and apply it to a problem I was working on. Or I would come across an explanation of a topic that was clearer than the textbook I had been reading. For that reason, I love blogs. I think they are fundamental to the expansion of ideas outside of academic circles. I hope the content of this blog is useful to others, and I am excited to see what comes of it!
